summary:
I have thirteen years experience working on mission in conflict zones including Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia, almost two years in Liberia Africa, and thirteen years in the Samoa Police. Ensuring the safety and security of staff members on mission areas, maintain the peace and order and apprehended offenders, giving assistance in the reforming and reconstruction of the new local police. All these have provided me useful skills which can substantially contribute to this position.

As a security officer in the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia â€“ ICTY, I have gained thirteen years experience of providing security in an international legal environment, including service in the field. I successfully completed Close Protection VIP Course, firearms training, security in the field. I also acted as occasional team leader and OIC for the accused escort team, liaising with the detention unit. I supervised shifts for the last three years
Furthermore, I have good communication skills and teamwork, reflecting the core competency in security and safety work.

In summary, I bring a sense commitment, dedication and professionalism to every aspect of my work, and I am confident that my expertise would greatly benefit organization. I enhance my career with the UN, building on previous experience in the ICTY, field missions and national police.
